:::::::::::::::::::::::: solution 

## Output
 
All of these examples could be considered an XR experience.
Although all have different levels of interactivity, sensory
input
as well as user-freedoms for moving within the environment.

:::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::

Distinction is made between XR experiences that:

- Display different **types of content**, and 
- Support **stereoscopic views**.
- Support different **Degrees of Freedom (DoF)** for the user, 

For each of these variations, user can access experiences through a variety of channels.
